intro: Jaborosa runcinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
